algo

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • algo.Path

  • public class Path
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a single path for one packman. Including a single packman, an ArrayList of fruit, and the time it takes for the packman to eat all of these fruit.
    Author:
    Eitan Lichtman, Netanel Indik

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Path(Packman p)
      This constructor receives a packman from a game, (our packman is pointing to the one from the game).
      Path(Packman p, java.util.ArrayList<Fruit> f)
      This constructor receives a packman from a game, (our packman is pointing to the one from the game).
      Path(Path ot)
      This constructor receives another path, and copies it to our path.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add_fruit(Fruit f)
      This method adds a single fruit to our list of fruits.
      java.util.ArrayList<Fruit> getFruits()
      This method returns the paths ArrayList of fruit.
      Packman getPackman()
      This method returns the paths packman.
      double getTime()
      This method returns the time it takes for the packman to eat all of the fruit in the path.
      void setTime(double time)
      This method allows to update the time for this path.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Path

        public Path(Packman p,
            java.util.ArrayList<Fruit> f)
        This constructor receives a packman from a game, (our packman is pointing to the one from the game). And receives an ArrayList of fruits that are copied to our path.
